pullrequest.title: Add Gaussian noise to cameras, issue #608

content.raw:
If you want to test out the camera noise, try this patch to multicamera_test.world. Here's an image illustrating several standard deviation levels. ![camera noise example](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/96660379/camera_noise.png)
~~~
diff -r dc2b05582713 test/worlds/multicamera_test.world
--- a/test/worlds/multicamera_test.world	Sun Mar 31 18:41:02 2013 -0700
+++ b/test/worlds/multicamera_test.world	Tue Apr 02 14:21:01 2013 -0700
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 <?xml version="1.0" ?>
-<sdf version="1.3">
+<sdf version="1.4">
   <world name="default">
     <include><uri>model://ground_plane</uri></include>
     <include><uri>model://sun</uri></include>
@@ -377,6 +377,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>0.01</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>
 
           <camera name="bottom_left">
@@ -391,6 +396,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>0.01</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>
 
           <camera name="bottom_right">
@@ -405,6 +415,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>0.1</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>
 
           <camera name="bottom_right_2">
@@ -419,6 +434,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>1</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>
 
           <camera name="bottom_right_3">
@@ -433,6 +453,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>10</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>
 
 
~~~
content.html:
If you want to test out the camera noise, try this patch to multicamera_test.world. Here's an image illustrating several standard deviation levels. 

diff -r dc2b05582713 test/worlds/multicamera_test.world
--- a/test/worlds/multicamera_test.world    Sun Mar 31 18:41:02 2013 -0700
+++ b/test/worlds/multicamera_test.world    Tue Apr 02 14:21:01 2013 -0700
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 <?xml version="1.0" ?>
-<sdf version="1.3">
+<sdf version="1.4">
   <world name="default">
     <include><uri>model://ground_plane</uri></include>
     <include><uri>model://sun</uri></include>
@@ -377,6 +377,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>0.01</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>

           <camera name="bottom_left">
@@ -391,6 +396,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>0.01</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>

           <camera name="bottom_right">
@@ -405,6 +415,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>0.1</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>

           <camera name="bottom_right_2">
@@ -419,6 +434,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>1</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>

           <camera name="bottom_right_3">
@@ -433,6 +453,11 @@
               <near>0.02</near>
               <far>100</far>
             </clip>
+            <noise>
+              <type>gaussian</type>
+              <mean>0.0</mean>
+              <stddev>10</stddev>
+            </noise>
           </camera>
